message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: public class JSONIteratorAuthor implements Iterator <Author> {
    private Iterator<JSONArray> authors;
    public JSONIteratorAuthor(JSONArray jsonArray){
        this.authors = jsonArray.iterator();
    }
    @Override
    public boolean hasNext() {
        return this.authors.hasNext();
    }
    public Author next() {
        if(this.hasNext()){
            Author a = new Author(0, "", "");
            JSONArray authorNode = authors.next();
            a.setFirstName((String) authorNode.get(0));
            a.setLastName((String) authorNode.get(1));
            return a;
        }
        else {
            return null;
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can directly use JSONArray as an iterator. In the next() method, you can get the first and second elements of the JSONArray as the first name and last name of the author. Please note that this assumes that the first and second elements of the JSONArray are the first name and last name, respectively. You may need to adjust this based on the actual structure of your JSON data.
